alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus; Mecklenburg (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 1:32AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Cabarrus and Mecklenburg Counties in North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Mallard Creek may be flooding the PNC Music Pavilion parking lots and other low-lying areas along Pavilion Boulevard. Further rises on the creek may flood portions of the Mallard Creek Greenway, as well as some roads in the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 132 AM EST, Minor flooding is already occurring in Mallard Creek below Stony Creek near Harrisburg, and additional rain showers are moving toward the area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have already fallen. - Mallard Creek below Stony Creek, near Harrisburg, is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charlotte, West Concord, Harrisburg, University City, Reedy Creek Park, Charlotte Motor Speedway, Hidden Valley and Croft. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
